meaning: You're in the early stage of your UX journey. Your main focus now is building strong fundamentals and getting hands-on with small projects.
dayToDayReality: Learning core UX concepts through courses, articles, and practice projects.
Working on small features or redesigns with guidance from more experienced designers.
Building your portfolio with real projects, even if they're personal or volunteer work.
Practicing wireframing, user flows, and basic usability principles.
Getting feedback from peers and mentors to improve your work.
commonMistakes: Jumping straight to high-fidelity designs without understanding the problem first.
Focusing too much on visual polish without learning UX fundamentals.
Not seeking feedback early and often in the design process.
Trying to learn everything at once instead of focusing on core skills.
nextGrowthFocus: Master the basics: problem statements, user flows, wireframes, and usability principles.
Build a habit of user research, even if it's just talking to 2-3 people.
Learn to work with design systems and component libraries.
Practice presenting your work and explaining your design decisions.
